duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform laboratory testing on patient specimens, ensuring accuracy and timeliness of results.
Adhere to laboratory procedures for collection, processing, analysis, and reporting of patient test results.
Conduct waived, highly and moderately complex laboratory procedures in areas such as Hematology, Chemistry, Urinalysis, Coagulation, Microbiology, and Immunology.
Perform and document maintenance on instruments and equipment as appropriate, and review the accuracy of patient results before release or reporting.
Recognize age-specific differences in expected results for various age groups and ensure compliance with laboratory policies and safety procedures.
May be assigned as Lead Tech in the absence of a supervisor, with responsibility for the section or department during their shift.
Assist in the development and maintenance of laboratory policies and procedures, and adhere to all department and hospital policies related to safety, infection control, and human resources.
Other tasks or responsibilities as assigned by the department manager/director.

education_certification.credential: Associates Degree in chemical, physical, biological science, or completion of coursework in a program for MLT.
ASCP certification, or equivalent, required within one year of employment.
Current and Valid State License if the laboratory is located in a state where required.
